ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3 hours.
2-3 hours per week
Less than an hour
3 hours
About 5-6 hours
4 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: good class
Strengths: real world examples, external lecturersWeaknesses: students should be more involved (e.g. group work)
Excellent. Very nice to hear from industry experts.

The strengths of this course were the guest lectures. It was very useful to hear about regulatory affairs from other professionals in the field. One weakness of the course is that the lectures were not always engaging.
Disappointment

I came in genuinely interested in regulatory affairs and left with absolutely no interest. The course was disorganized, covered inconsistent material and students had absolutely no incentive to attend class.

Strengths: There is no other course like this at YSPH and maybe even the university, so for that reason it's a good class. I also liked that the professor tried to bring in some speakers, even outside of class time, for us to learn more about the industry. I like that the tests are open book, open note.Weaknesses: I'm not sure if this is something that can really be changed, but the material is really dry at times. I wish there was a way to make it more interesting.
Professor is not receptive to student response and input. Lecture is very one sided.

strengths: I like how different speakers in the field came to talk so I can learn how it is like in the real world. Please keep on doing this!weaknesses: please be more clear on the expectation of the exams. Some questions are tricky and not well covered in class.

Overall I thought that this course was very informative and I learned a lot. One thing that I found frustrating was that the course sometimes felt unorganized. For example, we covered non-inferiority trials 2 different times and were given a draft guidance to read on them. I felt that instead of repeating things already covered we could have discussed a few more things from the book that were never mentioned in class at all.

The instructor is a very nice person who wants to teach and have everyone do well, but what he teaches has no bearing at all on what's on the test, which is silly. The textbook used to teach the course is written in such a way that you don't recall what you read as it is over technical. Many of us left the class not really informed of regulatory affairs or what the most important things were from the class. The guest lecturers were highlights of the course.
The course is very practical, and provides good insight into the topic. I particularly liked the approach of having many invited speakers to give lectures as part of the course.
It gave a big picture of how FDA works, but students will be easier to learn that if it's delivered in a more systematic way.
very useful coursetoo much information for one semester though
Course material was interesting, lectures poorly structured. Still feel like I learned a lot about the regulatory system.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Robert Makuch  good
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Strengths: real world examplesWeaknesses: some lectures were not well structured
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Excellent. Amazing background and experience.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr Makuch is very knowledgeable about regulatory affairs and brings a lot of experience to the class. In the future he can try to increase student participation in the course.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  The instructor doesn't do much

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Completely unavailable via email. Often was not available during post office hours. Very nice and pleasant, but seemed scattered.One instance that sits with me is we had a speaker from a pharmaceutical company come in and no one was there to introduce her or assist her, neither the TA or professor. She stumbled upon the correct room almost by accident and needed a student from the course to help her login to the computer to give her presentation. This just did not sit well with me.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  He's a good teacher. You can tell he is very knowledgeable about the subject and the internal politics of the FDA and other agencies. Sometimes he goes off on tangents that seem irrelevant, but overall he's a good professor.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Very good. I like all the stories and examples of how drug evaluation/development is like in the real world.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  I thought that Professor Makuch was a good instructor and his passion for the topic was obvious. My only issue was that we went off on a lot of tangents, and while I felt like the tangents were useful many times, sometimes we went off to the same tangents during multiple classes and I thought that time could maybe have been better used.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Please see above
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch is a very knowledgable and great instructor. I like that he structures the course in a flexible way, and focuses on very practical aspects of regulatory affairs.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Knowledgeable and interesting professor.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Good overall, great personality and really cares. Needs help in being more organized with course.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  was not at office hour
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  She did a nice job, I thank her for her time and availability :)
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  Excellent, prompt feedback.
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  It would have been great to receive feedback on our homework assignments.
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  Rachel is helpful
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  Rachel was excellent and attentive. I felt as though the entirety of the course was on her shoulders. She graded our homework and wrote and graded our exams.
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  She is a good TA, always responded to my homework emails and questions in a timely manner.
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  Very good. Efficient and answer our questions very quick.
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  I didn't have much interaction with Rachel but I appreciated that she alwaysreplied to homework submissions to say that she received them.
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  Rachel was great!
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  Did not interact with the TA except during exams.
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  Rachel had been very supportive.
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  Always respond in time, really good TA
Instructor: Rachel Heejin Bhak  really nice

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take this class if you are interested in regulatory affairs.
Definitely take if interested in career in this area or want to gain understanding.
This was a great course and I would recommend it to other students who are interested in hearing about how the FDA works.
Disappointment. Will not recommend others to take it
No I would not recommend it. This class was a disappointment.
I would recommend this course, but only if the student is really interested in this topic. Otherwise, it wouldn't be a good match for them.
I will definitely recommend it to others. Informative and eye-opening. I learned a lot about drug development and evaluation.

I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in learning more about regulatory affairs. There are very few other places to get the sort of information gained from the course and Dr. Makuch's first-hand knowledge really brings a personal aspect to the course.
Would not recommend unless teaching style of professor and the textbook changes.

If you are interested in regulatory affairs, definitely take the course. If you don't have a particular career-related interest in this topic, you might audit it. It's really fun, and not heavily time consuming.
I will recommend
It is a great introduction to regulatory affairs, well worth taking if the topic interests you. Homework and exams are not challenging, but you can learn a lot.
